I feel like Lovely Complex tried too hard. Or in any case, it failed to reach me.
I heard many good things about Lovely Complex and therefore decided to give it a shot, even though I couldn't really stand the art at all. I ended up being somewhat disappointed. 
The story starts out pretty good, having the main characters being portrayed as opposites, although quite alike. They develop on a very impressive scale throughout the anime, and by the end, something has really been established.
There wasn't just anything interesting in the anime. It was very predictable, sometimes it was a tad funny, other times it triedto be serious, which ultimately failed. I was just hoping for something more.\n\n
Is this a bad anime? No, not at all. Should you watch it? I don't know, I'm somewhat inclined to say no, considering there many romance anime out there which satisfied me a lot more. Then again, it wasn't terrible, it just, was. I suppose you yourself can be the judge, it's a tough one.

Ever watched a rom-com drama where you are tearing your hair out in agony, mixed with anticipation, mixed with joy, over the leads getting together?  That's the emotion evoked by the lovably dense, starring characters of this remarkable anime.
Lovely Complex (also know as LoveCom) is the story of two high school "frienemies" know as Risa Koizumi and Atsushi Otani.  These two butt heads in everything, yet are so similar they can't avoid becoming friends.  The problem?  They have a massive height difference.  With Otani clocking in 16 centimeters shorter than Risa, the friends are an amusing laughing stock to therest of the school and are likened to the famous All Hanshin Kyojin comedy duo.  From there, I'll let your imagination and curiosity do the rest.


Plot-wise, the story follows a typical highschool rom-com, but does it as well as it can be done.  The characters are ultimately where this show shines the brightest.  Risa and Otani are intensely stubborn individuals who can't pick up the basic signs put off by the other when it comes to romance.  The supporting cast is also perfect and bolsters the leads in ways that fit where they perfectly need to.  (This show is a great basic example of gender difference and how females and males give/read signs poorly when it comes to infatuation.  It's extremely amusing if you look to it on that level as well.)


Sound-wise, the show has a great first opening/ending theme that embodies perfectly the awkward fun and romp you are going to experience.  That being said, the second opening is lacking.  When episode 14 hit and the change happened, I have to say my first reaction was extremely disappointed.  The best that can be said about it is that it shows the progression into the "second act" of the story from that point on.  Other than that, it's just a poppy tune that doesn't do the anime's overall "body" and feel justice like the first did (the second ending is decent, not much to say there).  The in-show music pieces are very soothing to the ear and I enjoyed hearing the familiar tunes when they played (e.g. much like Maid-Sama! if you know where I'm coming from).


The art is very spastic (if I had to pick a word to embody it).  When it wants to be extremely ridiculous and funny, it nails it.  When it wants to be dramatic, serious, or romantic, it nails it.  (I especially like how Risa, as a female heroine, is portrayed as very naturally beautiful by going from hilariously ugly in the comedy bits to being very naturally cute when the artists want her to be.)  All in all, the art is exactly what it needs to be and captures the show's moods perfectly.


I'd be lying if I said I didn't consider this show for a rating of 10.  It accomplishes exactly what it wants to and is compelling when it comes to its character development.  I felt very satisfied by the end of this journey and was able to leave with a good sense of closure.  However, as I only use 10 for total "flawless" masterpieces (beyond just the category of enjoyment), a more level-headed rating is to be given (if a 9.5 rating was possible, I'd give it).


This show definitely ranks with the greats when it comes to the romantic drama genre (Kaichou wa Maid-sama!, Kimi ni Todoke, Toradora!, Clannad, etc.) and deservedly so!  The anime packs a punch on the comedy level, but also can get easily sentimental when it needs to.  It truly is just what it claims to be.....a lovely, lovely complex.

The first time that I watched Lovely Complex was arguably three years ago. Since then, it's been my go-to anime whenever I don't have an anime to watch. So if you're asking me if this anime has rewatchable-status, I'd say: "Yes; yes it does. Plenty." 
Story: 8
I've seen (what I'd consider) a good amount of romance based, shoujo, and (reverse) harem anime. Although the story's are all unique in their own certain light, most of these anime take a very conventional approach. Of course the boy likes girl/ girl likes boy, they (possibly) get together is inevitable, but what happens in between is what initiallyshapes the story and makes it memorable. Lovely Complex is surely a unique jab at the genre. For those of you who don't know what the story's about, it's about a girl named Koizumi Risa who happens to be taller than the average female, and a boy Otani Atsushi who is shorter than the average male. Because of their height complexes, they find it difficult to find someone who will accept them, and they find it daunting to do a lot of things in life because they're constantly made fun of. These two constantly argue about their height amongst other things. They're usually referred to as All Hanshin Kyojin because of this. Behind their bickering they have a lot in common and complement each other very well. This may seem conventional to boot, and yes: it's a pretty basic plot. But it's the story that's unique. Unlike most shoujo's, Risa realizes her feelings very quickly, and it all just goes uphill from there.


Art: 7

There's really not much to say about the art. If you want some glossy art style, this anime isn't for you. Go watch Special A if that's really what you desire. It's not glossy, but it's charming. I'm a big fan of the character design, I think it matches their personalities really well. This anime is really comedy based, which makes for a lot of... "bizarre" faces and reactions. When you come to terms with the fact that this isn't just an anime about love, you'll begin to accept it. I'll admit, it took me a little to get over it, but it certainly wasn't important. It added to the humor of the show, which is initially the whole point.


Sound: 8

"Kimi + Boku = Love?" has to be one of my all-time favourite theme songs. There are a few that come close (Nana, Death Note) but no theme song can make me get up and dance like an *cough* AHO (if you've seen LoveCom or heard someone from Osaka speak, hopefully you get my reference hehe). If I'm not dancing around in my underwear, I'm singing along. Most of all, I like the lyrics. Usually when lyrics are translated they end up making no sense whatsoever. But these lyrics really correspond to the show. The second theme song I have finally warmed up to. At first it threw me off, but now I find it sort of fun. I liked both of the ED's, and the corresponding images. The in-show score can sometimes get repetitive, but if you're not going crazy marathoning, it shouldn't be too bad.


Character: 10

I think that this is the first time in an anime that I have ever -- like ever -- given a perfect score. I cannot express how much I enjoy these characters. Sometimes they're a bit fickle and simple minded, but who am I to complain? When I've liked a guy, I'm often thinking, "I'm done. Wait, no. Actually, yes. I don't like him. Okay, I do. He pisses me off. He makes me so happy." It's just what high school students do. Of course these characters have their flaws (Risa is somewhat of a crybaby and Otani is dense as hell) but even with that weighing them down, they're great characters. I'm so tired of watching shoujo's with mindless bishies. Bishies, I find, are usually only there to look hot and be mysterious. I don't know what kind of girls actually find that endearing, but I find it fucking annoying. Get a personality. Luckily, Lovely Complex doesn't have that. Risa and Otani are so different than anything that I've seen in an anime. They act like real people. They're not broody, mysterious and secretly sad inside, waiting for someone to knock down the walls that they spent building. They're just people. That's the end of it. As for the secondary characters, they're really only there to be secondary characters. There is only one episode that doesn't completely revolve around Otani and Risa. But that's all right. Even though their friends are not the main focus, they still have plenty of personality. Nobu-chan is probably one of the best friends that someone could ever have. She's kind and modest, but she'll kick you in the ass if she has to. Chiharu is timid and quiet, but her friends really mean a lot to her. As for their boyfriends, I prefer Nakao. He's such a minor character with a limited amount of lines, but when he does speak, it's usually simplistically funny. As for the other characters that get introduced, I can only think of one that I reallllly didn't have a hankering for. The chemistry between all of these characters is seriously flawless. 


Enjoyment: 9

I think the fact that I've told every one of my anime-watching friends, forced my sister, and my mom to watch it, says something. I've at least seen this anime 5 times through. I'm usually trying to find a new anime that I can watch to pass the time, but rarely do I find one that I'm so wrapped up in. The dynamic between the two main characters is really unlike something I've seen before. This anime also does a very respectable job of balancing the comedy and the romance. Usually an anime can specialize in one well, but very rarely does an anime do both of them well. I can finish this anime in a day, no problem. I laugh, I cry, I feel happy, and I feel sad. A problem that a few people have with this anime is that the ending is anti-climatic. And to he honest, it is. But why is that bad? I think for something outstanding to happen  on the last episode would just be unrealistic and too expected. The ending is exactly how it should be in my opinion. 


Overall: 9

This anime is, without a doubt, one of my favourite anime ever. My anime watching career was spoiled since I watched this anime early on. Every time I watch a new romance I'm left thinking ".___. this isn't as good as Lovely Complex." Seriously, it messed me up. But I appreciate this story so much. It gives me hope for future shoujos. If you want a great rom. com, I heavily recommend this one. As cliche as it sounds, it has everything AND MORE. It's great for all audiences, and if you have any more questions, feel free to ask me. I hope you give it a chance!

Lovely Complex is my favorite rom com anime by far.  
STORY : Best friends.  Girl is tall and boy is short.  Girl likes boy.  Boy likes girl as a friend.  It's nothing really special, but most plots in anime are boring but can be so enjoyable.  This is one of those.  Most of the series is just the girl trying to get the guy.  
ART : LOVE THE ART.  Everything is so bright and sunny.  I think Risa is such a pretty character.  Otani is pretty cute, too.  The rest of the casthas kinda weird looking characters.  It reminds me of Bokura ga Ita.  


Sound : Koizumi's voice is decent, although I wish she didn't say Otani they way she did.  It fits her character.  I really like Otani's voice.  


Character : Risa and Otani are practically the same person in different bodies.  They are super quirky and crazy.  Tbh, I didn't care for anyone else besides those two.  


Enjoyment : This anime made me laugh and cry. It's mostly comedy, but there were a few parts I got teary eyed for Risa.  She's a really relatable character.  I stayed up until 3 just to finish marathoning it because it was so good.


Overall : Wasn't a cheesy rom com.  It had good character development. Also, you could see the feelings develop through out the episodes.  Most rom coms just have the characters like each other right off the bat.  It's a lot about unrequited love, which I think is somewhat uncommon in animes.  Watch it, it's a lot of fun.

The most annoying thing about this anime is the Kansai-ben that starts to grate on your sensibilities if you have been watching anime spoken in standard Japanese for a while. The other annoying thing is the use of too much slap-stick during the inital parts of the anime . 
However, once you adapt or ignore these aspects, the story itself is quite engaging and somewhat interesting even if you couldn't care about romance and the like. The humor is mildly entertaining even if it is too base in its methods. 
On the characters side, there are some inaccuracies that are disturbing. The male characters areall pretty much 2-dimensional and dry while the female characters are more detailed. This could be because the anime is aimed at female audience but even that fails to compensate for lack of character depth. \n\n
All in all, the anime is a passable 7/10 .

It's definitely not typical shoujo anime, it has a well developed characters, and you can tell they put a lot of effort into the story..I'm not much into Romantic-comedy...But this was a different story... 
It has just the right amount of jokes and the main girl doesn't beat up the boy every single second and call him a pervert....
You could actually understand the characters feelings as well...
I couldn't Imagine Risa and Otani ever being together but I really got into it later..It always keeps you wanting more
You'll definitely like it if you're looking for a fun,romantic anime and something that stands out..!

Lovely Complex Review
Story : Koizumi Risa, a 170cm taller-than-the-average-girl, asks for the help of Atsushi Otani, a 150cm shorter-than-the-average-boy for help with her love affairs, and vice versa. Unfortunately, and quite predictably, this is a disaster, especially when, horror of horrors, Risa realises she's falling in love with Otani! What follows is Risa's heartwarming quest to get the guy of her dreams to fall in love with her.
Art : The art is brilliant. I love Risa's changing hairstyles and the little touches and changes that showing them growing up, but so slightly that it's only when you're presented with flashbacks you can actually tell. 
Sound: I loved the soundtrack. My favourite was the piano/strings in 'World's End' and also 'Dry Tears', a piano track. Even the opening and ending music was mirroring the feel of the anime itself.\n\n
Character : Each character, even the rivals, are likable. Watch out for Haruka and Nobu-chan as two hysterical characters you won't be able to stop laughing at. Risa is a brilliant heroine and Otani is the type of guy you'd want on your arm. Brilliant heartwarming characters who you will love and miss once you've finished the anime.\n\n
Overall : I couldn't pull myself away from this anime for even a minute. It starts off with 170cm taller-than-average girl, Koizumi Risa, joining forces with a 152cm shorter-than-average guy, Atsushi Otani, to get the girl and guy they like.\n
What happens in the next 24 episodes will have you laughing, crying, and clutching at your chest as you watch them, and their friends (watch out for Nobuko, Risa's best friend, and Haruka as golden characters) grow up and fall in love. You can't help but love every last character, even the rivals like Mimi-chan. Each episode is well worth watching and the whole anime wastes no time in trivial matters, throwing itself into each minute with abandon. And you, as you watch it, will probably do the same.

Overall	
I must say I really fell in love with this show during the very first episode. Sadly, it didn't last. The first few episodes are great and promising, but pretty soon the story gets stuck and never really gets anywhere.
This show is very reminiscent of ToraDora and School rumble, but where the former is cousy and heartwarming and the latter is darn funny, "Lovely complex" turned out to be neither, but just a tedious waste of time.
Animation	
I really love this art style, all the characters are wonderfully designed with a pretty non-standard-anime look, and there are plenty of hilarious facial expressions.
Too bad the animators failedbig time with making the characters move and interact with their surroundings. The animation is is stiff and generally bad.


Still, a high score for marvellous character design.


Edit: The drawing style reminds me a lot of the "Power!!" manga, btw. Could be made by the same people, I don't know.


Sound	

OP/ED suck (plus, the animations during the songs are mostly just cut-and-paste from the epidodes). Voice acting is not great but not bad either. I guess the bad animation adds to the feeling of akwardly performed voices.


Story	

Like School rumble (and most other high school romantics) the story consist entirelly of nervous hesitating people trying to confess their love for each other. It gets really tedious, and the story could have been compressed into 12 episodes at most. As it is, most of the episodes are fillers and everything is generally very slow paced.


Another reason for the yawn-factor is that the series focuses on only two people and their love story. If the side characters had gotten more screen time and interesting subplots this could have worked.


Character	

Most of the characters are likeable and nice, but the only ones that really get any attention are Risa and Otani. Despite their 26 episodes of screen time, they hardly manage to develop at all. Neither do the supporting characters (well, in the last few episodes they actually get to show some interesting sides of themselves), and they are mostly there as a background.

I watched a bit of the first episode a while back and put it down... I'm so glad I came back to it, it is literally one of my favorite Anime now. Right up there beside Itazura na kiss. I don't know what it is about Anime with unrequited love, but I definitely love them and wish there were more out there!! 10/10

This is a completely girly shoujo anime and I love it! It's about a super tall girl who falls for a really short guy and it's done in a really sweet and funny way and to me,  does feel the way high school love felt, full of doubt, confusion, desire, and DRAMA. I think what I like best is that their romance is not based on love at first sight, they actually dislike each other quite a lot to begin with, but then come to see that they have a lot in common and their personalities are really good for each other. When Otaniis down, it's Risa who shouts him into shape and when he needs help, she never lets him down. Whenever they forget that they hate each other and let their guards down they end up having a really great time. And falling in love isn't easy at all; Risa is the one who likes him at first, and he doesn't immediately love or hate her, he just doesn't know what he wants and it drives her crazy. I think when I was in high school, life was like that, nothing was really that simple. I also really love the humor, especially the hilarious faces they make. I think it's funnier than it is romantic, and I like it. \n

As a male sometimes it can be difficult to find a good shoujo romance. In general I find them more mature and reasonable than shounen romance, but some of the targeting affect miss the mark on me. However, Lovely Complex is one of my favorite romantic comedies of all time. In fact it was on my top 10 a year or two ago. It is a very relaxing, funny, and cute show that avoids many of the pit holes I see in other romantic comedies.
The story follows Risa and Ootani, whose nicknames are 'Amazoness' and 'chibi' (midget) in reference to their height. They are knownin school for being a pair of comedians despite their best efforts to avoid acting as such. To this I can testify that the two of them are indeed a perfect pair of comedians. The show had a really good sense of humor: Good enough for even the serious person I am to admit it. While the show has a similar amount of drama to other shows, the comedy really helps to prevent the drama from overwhelming you by keeping the show bright and happy.


One of my favorite things in this show is that Risa is as active in the story as Ootani. I find it frustrating that many female leads in shoujo shows let the male interest take the spotlight, and do most of the 'things' to make the show what it is (this is obviously vise versa in shounen). However, this show does a good job of making both sides proactive, and letting all the characters carry weight in the show. Perhaps that wasn't well phrased so I will reword it as neither of the leads outshines the other. They are a very good fit together, and it is hard to get tired of seeing the two of them interact.


The other characters in the show play an important role as well. I felt like all the characters acted really real, aka not making really illogical mistakes, and fit into the story well. Overall, I think the characters possessed the necessary amount of depth to make the show a blast to watch.


The plot is simple, after all it is a drama, romantic, comedy. The arcs are very well executed, so that I never felt irritated at the characters actions nor felt as if the situation was dragging on too long. Being twenty four episodes long, they fit all the story and comedy together very nicely. It is hard to elaborate more than saying that I can only recall loving this show for it. The art style is pretty modest especially being made in 2007, but I think it is also somewhat unique and fits the show really nicely.


Overall, even after years I fondly recollect this show as possibly my favorite shoujo anime. I have thrown the weighted word 'shoujo' around, so I would like to clarify that was for comparison purposes. In fact, I think that this is a romantic comedy that almost anyone could enjoy, thus I suppose I should completely disregard tagging the show to a target demographic. As a very funny and cute romantic comedy I think this is a must see for those interested in a relaxing romance story.

Lovely Complex has got to be one of my favourite shoujo, and why? because its not a boring cliche! Its almost impossible to find a shoujo that isn't the same as another. We get together, rumors, we break up, we get together, and so on.
Lovely Complex focuses more on the insecurities of teenage romance and is extremely relatable, especially for girls, but maybe even so for boys...
Though the art isn't always top notch and the character development is a little minimal, you're drawn to not even think about it as you laugh at "All Hanshin Kyojin" ever-so-funny Otani and Koizumi, who always either have theother's back or at each other's necks. Or drawn by the passion of Nobuko and Nakao, or the adorable shy atmosphere of Suzuki and Chihara. \n
Otani and Koizumi, along with their height complexes, are extremely unique and Lovely Complex is defiantly worth watching.

Well, what can I say?
Lovely Complex is one of the most unique romance/comedy animes I've watched so far. If you're a sucker for romance and comedy, then I highly recommend this anime to you.
Story:
A slightly smaller from the average height guy(Otani) and a slightly taller from the average height girl(Koizumi) are classmates in a high-school and keep on teasing and insulting each other. Therefore, they're called The All Hanshin Kyojin, after a pair of comedians with a similar height difference. They become good friends when one day, Koizumi suddenly realizes she sees Otani more than just a friend, though she doesn't admit it at first...Is it possible for a girl be together with a guy smaller than her?..


I think the story is very unique which is the main reason why I give this anime's storyline 10 points. This anime breaks (so to speak) lots of "society rules" or "stereotypes" or "idealism" such as, when you have a boyfriend, he must be taller than you and etc.


Art:

I'm quite picky when watching anime: the art must be bearable for me.. and I just think the art here is good, although there are times the characters are oddly drawn, that's why I give it a nine for art.


Sound:

The background sounds are always PERFECT TIMING,adding an effect to what's happening.


Character:

Both characters' personalities are simply outstanding for me. I think the character development is good.


Enjoyment:

As mentioned, if you're a BIG SUCKER for romance/comedy animes with a slapstick humor, then this is the jackpot for you. Lovely Complex is the perfect anime for romance fans. It's sweet, funny... and extremely enjoyable! :)


Overall:

Well, I'd give it a ten... 'coz I'm a huge sucker for romance.

So, I started off watching this just because I realllllllly needed to do something, and I ended up falllllling head over heels in love with it. It's definitely not like other animes. I say this because I've tried watching other love/comedic animes, and i always find myself comparing them to Lovely Complex. It not only leaves you feeling good inside,  it will also make you want to falll in love. :) And we all need some love in our lives. This anime was just completely enjoyable and heartfelt.
Story: It was great, not like most animes where the guy and girl fall in love immediately.It shows the steps and hardships that each go through to realize their feelings. It was comedic, lovable, and unique.


Art: The art wasn't the best, but it was great for this type of anime. It didn't need to be super artistic to tell the story the way it was. 


Sound: Uh, it's sound. You can turn on the volume up if it's not loud enough.


Characters: You're going to grow to love every character. Even though the female protagonist is a bit of a baby, she plays it off well. (: They're all quite lovable and fun (:


Enjoyment: i'm sure you'll LOVEEEE it as much as i do. Well, i hope so anyway. (:

I usually try to find anime that I feeling peckish for. Sometimes I want to watch a comedy, other times a school romance. And sometimes, I give an anime a go and if I don't like it, I drop it. This anime was once of the rare instances that I watch an anime, I get hooked on it and in the middle of the show makes me want to get rid of it, but I keep on going because I'm very hooked. For that, I really enjoyed this anime! 
Sure, at first glance, it's a typical school romance with a girl that likes a boyand the the boy likes her, but really it's more than that. I ran into this beautiful anime when I was done watching Toradora. I loved that anime so much I had to try this one too! And I found it very relaxing and hilarious. The main characters start out as friends, which made me very hooked because it's basically like real life. Most anime romance school stories are more the girl automatically loving the guy to death, when really in reality, it's not like that. As they go on in the school years together, they start to realize their feelings. Of course, without the obstacles a long the way, they start that.



At the end, it was a beautiful story with good ideas that went well. Good for you Lovely Complex! ;3


Okay, enough of that, let's get on with business.


Story: I guess I incorporated that in the intro of this review. xD But once again, it may seem like your average school romance, when it's may be some of that, it is much more. It gives new insight on how a anime can go, some realism in it and it can still be the best out there.


Art: I love the art in this anime. Very beautifully drawn and good color choices. I also love when they start going into chibi or some other form of parody. 


Sound: Good music, I liked the opening and close songs, very well put in. And the background music was awesome as well.


Character: I liked the character development in this story, not only as growth development, but also the romance development between characters. The characters personality were to die for and made this anime successful.


Enjoyment: I loved it so much, I laughed, I got angry and I cried with the characters. That rarely happens to me in some animes, but this is one of them that did. and for that, I give it a high score. And also it made me a fan of it that I actually saw the movie based on this anime, which I enjoyed as well. :3


Overall: awesome anime! Good story and art. Combined with the characters development and hilarity, gives it a good anime. And it even makes me want to go see it again. So I say, YAY! :3 So watch and enjoy peoples! Enjoy!

This is my first review on MAL..(:
I first watched Lovely Complex last summer.  I just rewatched it a third time last month.  Lovely Complex will always be my favorite anime.  It will always be the first one I recommend to people.  LovCom is a story that, at first, made me turn away.  Tall girl with short guy?  There was just no way that could be appealing.  Thank goodness for long, eventless, summer days - the only reason why I picked up this anime I had put aside for so long.  I went from uninterested to finishing the anime, reading the manga, and watching the liveaction, in a week.  This is really a one of a kind anime.


STORY

The story, as stated above, turned me away at first.  But once I got into it, I realized how sweet it really was.  Being a taller girl myself, it's easy to relate to Risa.  The only animes I recommend to people are ones that can make me both laugh like crazy at my screen as well as cry like a baby in bed.  Lovely Complex is one of the few.  The comedy is hilarious, well though out and placed perfectly throughout the story.  When more serious scenes come around, you can't help but feel your eyes start to water.  The story ions that stands out amongst other romantic-comedy anime,  fulfilling both the romance and (especially) the comedy.


ART

The art was another factor that made me unwilling to watch Lovely Complex at first.  Pastels and the art style in general were just not at the top of my list.  However, this again was just my poor judgement.  After the first episode, the art had already grown on me.  The facial expressions are especially priceless.


SOUND

Not much to say.  No complaints.  I really enjoyed hearing the Kansai dialect.


CHARACTER

All the characters are so ...lovable.  They're all unique in the ways, but together they make a great cast.  Risa, her two supporting friends, and Otani and his two supports.  My only complaint in this deparment is Risa's crying.  At some points, it's perfect, it makes the audience want to cry with her.  But then at other points... its just out of place.  Nonetheless, the character development really flows.


OVERALL

I will recommend this anime to anyone and everyone who asks for recommendations.  It's the only anime I have rewatched over two times, and one I'm planning on rewatching again.. and again.  If you are turned away by the story like I was, all I have to say is... give it a chance.  Even if it's because you have absolutely nothing else to watch and you're dying of boredom under the summer heat, watch it! :)

I'd gotten plenty of recommendations for Lovely Complex in the beginning, however, my first impression of the details of it weren’t great - it seemed like it'd be a very cliché rom-com shoujo leaving not very much emotion or originality. However, once I had started watching it, my opinion completely changed, and I can say that this is one of my favourite shoujo animes.
The story focuses on the main two protaganists - Risa Koizumi and Atsushi Otani - and their friendship and how it eventually develops into a relationship. The story handles the romance aspect very well. Unlike other shoujos, which often have love thatseems unrealistic by happening too quickly, or having the characters confess at the end of the series, Lovely Complex had a very realistic pace to the relationship. It begins with their strong friendship by being known as the 'comedy duo' - and friends are all they are in the beginning. Koizumi realises her feelings, and puts up a fight to get the often dense Otani to realise them. The story is not predictable; at many times I found myself eager for the outcome of a situation which in any other anime would be obvious. This is a result of the dynamic character cast. The plot doesn't feature huge, overdramatic love triangles - opposing love interests enter the anime, but their stay is never out welcomed and they leave when due, never causing you to become really annoyed at the episode. 


The comedy in this series is fantastic. I more often than not prefer dramatic romances over comedic romances, because I don't always find shoujo comedy to my tastes and find the themes overdone. However, the comedy in here often had me laughing out loud. Even if you're not a huge fan of the rom-com genre, you'll definitely enjoy the humour in Lovely Complex.


The anime has a realistic feel to it. Unlike other animes which have a lot of story progress over a short amount of time, this anime happens at a great pace. It takes place over 3/4 years of their high school life. It often has a slice-of-life feel, and I don’t think there were any cliché filler episodes. Aside from the romance and comedy, it deals with other coming of age issues like deciding on future plans, exams and physical insecurity, although it never gets over serious.


The characters are a very strong point in Lovely Complex. Koizumi, the main girl, isn’t overly cute, clumsy and whiney, nor is she tsundere. Instead, she is very realistic – she can be funny, optimistic, friendly, strong-willed and brash, but she can also be emotional, insecure, indecisive and dramatic. Koizumi is extremely easy to relate to, particularly if you’ve been in a similar situation to her character. Her character matures over the course of the series once she realises things and gets help from her friends.


Otani’s character is somewhat similar to Koizumi’s in the way that he is also funny, friendly and insecure. However, he is also determined, caring and clueless, especially when it comes to Koizumi’s feelings for him. Although he often seems carefree and dense, he also has a deep and mature side to him, often worrying about Koizumi even if he finds it hard to admit.


The supporting cast are also great. Nobu, Koizumi’s best friend, is girly, helpful and assertive. She is a great best friend, often helping Koizumi, despite the fact that she can seem annoying at times. The rest of the supporting cast are also great – ranging from the quiet couple of Chiharu and Suzuki to the annoying but comedic Haruka and Seiko. 


The art took me a little while to get used to, though once I did, I really enjoyed it. The changing clothes, hairstyles and individual fashion senses (in the girls mainly) were really interesting to see. The guys were all good looking in their own right without being the typical shoujo hero with floppy hair, pointy faces, shiny eyes and lanky bodies. The bright colours reflect the feel of the show and its characters. The opening themes were both quite nice and upbeat, and the background music throughout the show fit in perfectly. I really liked how all of the cast’s accents reflected them living in Osaka and how noticeable their Kansai dialect was.


Overall, Lovely Complex is a very good shoujo anime. It’s the perfect mix of realistic romance and comedy, also showing great friendships. If you’re looking for an anime that isn’t too serious and focuses mainly on one couple rather than a love triangle with great characters, Lovely Complex is one to check out.

First off let me say that I enjoy watching romantic anime, I've watched quite a few, including some of the highly rated ones and according to the score here on MAL, this show should be among them.
I believe most of the good things about Lovely Complex were already said in other reviews, I'll just share what I didn't like about it.
1. The two main characters get annoying real fast. 
Seriously, the heroine (Koizumi) cries literally every or every other episode, usually for no reason (period?) and her Japanese voice over (squeaky, high-pitched) started getting on my nerves within a couple episodes. I didn't have thatbig of a problem with to-be boyfriend Ootani's voice actor, besides that super fake laugh (almost robotic "hahahah"). 


2. Very slow story progress.

This is a problem with most romantic anime(s), since there's just not enough "content" when it comes to love between (only) two people. Ever since you start watching the show, you know they get together sooner or later, what matters is the path towards their relationship, rather than the actual result. Now that would be completely fine, if so many romantic shows didn't have this many filler episodes. Every single time it almost seems like the pair might become a couple, some "coincidence" happens and all the progress characters made gets scratched. 

She tells him she loves him? Nope, he isn't paying attention at the moment or he's too dense to realize. He kisses her? Nope, that's just a misunderstanding. He tells her he feels the same way about her as she does about him? Nope, she falls asleep. 

The only result of that is the show acting like nothing happened and all that indicates any progress in the story are flashbacks and pointless monologues or thought processes that only act as another filler and have no meaning whatsoever.

The solution? If the show is as straightforward as this one - only one possible love interest, no major plot twist, etc. - then there's no point at making it to 24 episodes (or even more). 12-13 eps would be more than enough.


Half of the show is about Koizumi trying to figure out her feelings / trying to figure out Ootani's feelings / trying to date Ootani / crying about everything / about Ootani being dense and playing hard-to-get even though it's obvious he likes her, and so on.


3. It's really nothing special.

"Complex" because their heights are different, I get it. Is that enough to make the story interesting to me? No. What makes the show interesting are the characters and I really did like them at first, but as I said, 24 episodes is way too many and I got tired of them. The last couple episodes were pretty entertaining (18-24) and so was the beginning (before Koizumi sharing her feelings), but the empty spot in between 10th-ish and 18th episode was super boring, sadly.


All that being said, it's still somewhat decent anime with a couple of funny moments and "feels" moments, definitely not a 8-9/10, but a solid 6,5 for sure.

So anyways great anime you should watch it!

The perfect romance anime. Lovely Complex gets into the difficulties of finding love when people consider you "abnormal". Certain requirements are established by both men and women for a mate. When these requirements aren't met, then you can be readily discarded. Being fat or short or overly tall or poor or not that attractive are all too often the abnormalities that make people reject potential mates. It's an uncontrollable evolutionary response. What happens when two "abnormals" fall in love? Lovely Complex happens.

LovelyComplex was a spur of the moment watch for me. I didn't really expect anything out of it when I first started and I really didn't expect to enjoy as much as I did.
LovelyComplex follows around the two main characters Koizumi Risa and Ootani Atsushi showing progression as their relationship being a Comedy duo that start trying to help each find a significant other. This ends up being difficult and problematic since Koizumi-san is around 180cm tall or around 5.6 feet where on the other hand Ootani-kun is on the other side of the equation being only 152 cm or around 5.1 feet significantly shorterthan majority of his classmates and a pebble compared to Koizumi-san.


Story: I feel that the anime did okay in terms of telling the story, I have read bits of the manga and I know there are a couple things extra you get out of the manga compared to the anime and those would've added more depth to their relationship. Also, at the same time I can definitely see its flaws if your someone with a little less patience when it comes to story telling it may get a little difficult towards the middle and may feel a bit dragged out, which if you can suffer through I would say is worth it.  7/10


Art: The art style being a little strange at first, you quickly get used too. It has its uniqueness to it for sure. 7/10


Sound: There are moments in the anime that the background music or even the sound effects to add more to the scenes exist, but they really didn't get my attention and are not really remember-able. 6/10


Character: The characters is where I think this anime shines in a good way and in a bad way. The supporting characters to both Ootani and Koizumi are good, but I feel they leave something wanting. They have nice personalities and they are relevant to majority of the story. But, again I feel its going back to not having much depth or background to them as I would've perfered, unfortunate cause I really enjoyed the cast of characters. 8/10


Overall: I would say watch it, if you can deal with a little drag in the middle. But otherwise I would say the anime leaves off at a good place. Also, there is the manga to go too, if you feel a little un-satisfied. I have only read the last two chapters of the manga since its not really long and I can say there are somethings in the manga that I would definitely would've liked to see in the anime. I really did enjoy this anime and I think its a nice addition to the plethora of romance animes and comes with a bit extra with its sense of humor.

Lovely Complex is, as others have said, an incredibly sweet show. However I found it sweet for reasons other than the heart-melting romance and unbearably cute scenes between Risa and Otani. 
I think anyone can relate to Risa's character. Those who haven't experienced love may idealize it, and equate a perfect romance with something tangible like physical appearance. Risa is initially no different. She's never been in a real relationship and all she wants is to experience love- and she finally does, and in the most pure way. 
Risa and Otani learn what it means to like a person for who that person is, nomatter how much others may laugh or try to bring them down. The show demonstrates something very important: love isn't fulfilling in giving you the perfect person, but erasing the need for perfection.\n\n
I highly recommend this series for anyone who knows what it's like to have something you're insecure about- and that's going to include a large amount of people. If you think, for whatever reason, that you don't deserve love, this show will teach you a lot of things. It'll make you feel gratitude for the smallest of moments, and the most unlikely of people.

This may just be one of my favorite rom com animes of all time! I really can't find words to describe it other than amazing and one of the best there is. All the characters that we are introduced to are all very well developed and while we don't get a backstory on them when the time does come when we hear about their past it's all something we can closely relate to. I went through something incredibly similar in high school so this hit home for me. I've watched this series 4 times and enjoyed it every time. This anime tells you not togive up on someone or something. Always try your best and give it your all. Honestly with the way the world is now it is still true to this day! Try your best and don't give up at all! It told us that love can happen even in the most awkward situations even though it takes time. You just have to be willing to put the effort in. Easily one of the best anime around if you like rom com anime! The only thing left is for me to own this anime and my life is set. It tells such a in depth story that isn't seen these days! Enjoy life while you can and always give your all! There is someone out there for you, all it takes is time. This will show you that! Lovely Complex is one of the greatest of all time! This anime had a perfect ending so that no one is left disappointed and everyone leaves on a happy note! I highly recommend this anime to anyone who enjoys rom com's or just love those high school anime because this is perfect! Lovely Complex gets a 10/10 every time!

Lovely Complex is one of my all time favorite animes. I laughed and I cried, I smiled and I fall in love with all the characters. It's a shoujo anime, with LOTS of comedy moments and romance, and some drama too. It's a light comedy, fun to watch and so innocent, without any sexual content. 
Let's begin... Story 8/10. 
It's not really original. Lovely Complex tell us the story of a boy and a girl. The girl's name is Koizumi Risa, that is 172 centimetres and the boy, Atsushi Otani, is 156 cm. Because of their heights, they are called "All Hanshin Kyojin", a popularcomedy duo, that like them, have a similar height difference. That's basically what it is. I'm not really good explaining stories, sorry... 


Art: 7/10

The art in LoveCom is simple and cute. The personages are very well drawn, but nothing really excepcional. Hot bishounens, like Maity-sensei and cute girls, like Chiharu and Mayu. Something I like about the art in Lovely Complex are the way their faces are designed, but I think it's just my opinion. 


Sound: 9/10 

The songs in Lovely Complex are great! They envolve you and are perfect for the story, especially the second opening, "Hey!Say!" by the group with the same name. The first opening is actually pretty good too and fun.


Character: 8/10

Not totally original, but they envolve you and in sometimes you feel the same they feel. When Risa is sad because Otani's stupidity, or when she is rejected, there is no way, you feel sad for her. Otani is a moron sometimes, but you learn to love him and he is just so cute. The others characters are pretty good too, like Risa's friends, especially Nobu-chan (I want a friend like that too!) and Nakao, Nobu-chan's boyfriend. 


Enjoyment: 9/10

I gave a 9 because I think Lovely Complex is that much, it's really good. If you are a shoujo fan and even a romantic comedy fan, watch it, I'm pretty sure you will like it. The characters, the sounds, the story and the other things really make me love this show. 


Overall: 9/10

I cannot describe so good this anime and give something less than a 9. I don't have anything more to say. I just reccommend you: go and watch it! Because Lovely Complex is one of the greatest anime ever. 


I hope you like it!

Lovely Complex I believe to be one of the better romance comedies that anime has to offer. Unlike a lot of other romance involving the school scenario, this anime actually happens to show the span of their relationship through the entirety of high school.
The two main characters have great chemistry together, even though vastly different in physical aspects, they really have a lot in common allowing for them to be thrown into some really enjoyable scenarios. The supporting characters aren't really well made and I think they would really just linger around the two main characters.
The music for this anime is pretty good and sometimeshad me nodding my head to the beat, and the opening is great as well.\n\n
The art style is also very good its not a masterpiece, but at least it didn't have me thinking whether or not it was drawn by a 7 year old. \n\n
All in all, this anime is very enjoyable and if you like romance comedies you will love this one, but if not, still give it a shot, it's totally worth it.

I absolutely adore this series, Iv both seen and read it, both are amazing.
This series really hit home for me, every moment of it; for me it was a what if type of deal, tall girl falls in love with her short best friend, they have so much in common, at first he doesn't see her that way but over time he comes to love her, for me that was basically my high school years (minus the fact that I never got past the first rejection).
I think this is a must see for romance fans.

My second review gonna try to keep it brief here since my first was pretty lengthy..... but dont count on it i have a tendency to go on. (FINAL COPY HAD TO RE EDIT so i deleted the previous they are just about the same though)
Lovely Complex
Story- A love story between a boy(Otani) & a girl (Risa Koizumi) basically the story is between these two. Risa tries to find a boyfriend who she can love she has never dated or kissed anyone prior to that shes not the avg girl shes 172 cm tall which is tall for the avg highschool girl in japan.Otani is a person she walks home with they are like a comedy duo and best friends, he stands at 156 cm so Risa ends up falling for him eventually when they start to get closer and not as a comedy duo he rejects her at first and the story truly begins from their and her rocky 3 year journey to make Otani fall in love with her the same way she fell for him.


Art- The art was decent nothing too special but the expressions in characters faces at times were really well done and overall i thought the art was good but nothing special stood out. I give the art an 8/10 because again the anime was made in 2007 or so and back those years ago things werent looking all great as they do now it looked good for its time.


Sound- The music is ok never really won me over or anything so i thought it was decent for the entire anime. Although the music never won me over or anything mainly cuz i was paying more attention to the story the music goes with the scenes throughout the show. The opening is really nice as well.


character- The characters that really glue you in are otani and Risa so im gonna talk about them entertaining comedy duo funny alot throughout the show Risa goes through plently of character development when it comes to trying to be with otani failing and changing the way she thinks failing and not giving up and failing and just moving on shes also clumsy talks alot, cheery, funny.and hides her inner feelings. Otani is kinda static throughout the series he doesnt really change a whole lot but as hes pressed with questions and all his character changes to suit the scene which is always important and it turned out to be quite decent. Their are other characters but these where really the only two that glued you in the other supporting characters perform their roles well.


enjoyment- i enjoyed the anime quite a bit not a top 5 favourite probably a top 10 im a fan of romantic comedy animes as well as shoujo even though its not really "guy stuff" the show is enjoyable just for the fact that you want to see Risa get through the tough times and finally get what she deserved. Drama, suspense, laughter, the feels.


overall- 10/10 honestly its a suprise to me to the art is outdated because the anime is like 8 years old sound is good but not the greatest although the categories are not all 10's overall i thought it was the perfect romance anime and when you become emotionally attached to something thats when you know that it is really good.


FINAL JURISDICTION- Not your typical comedy, romance anime its alot deeper the story is really dang good and keeps you interested to see whats gonna happen next and really excells in the story area a somewhat kinda slow paced show when it comes to the love portion but fast paced in how they portray the years you will understand what i mean when you watch it and that  is what really makes it stand out compare to other romantic animes while others jump to having love at first sight Lovely Complex's story gives you a great feeling when its all said and done and when hard work pays off you have nothing left but good things to say because you put in all your effort and received the outcome you deserved. I feel like calling it a masterpiece but im not gonna go there its just a really outstanding story that builds and builds and then gives you exactly what you want by the end.

enjoy watching it, it's worth to see. ^_^

This anime is amazing! I recently started watching shouju anime and this one definitely hit the spot for me. Others I enjoyed had weak endings or weak parts in between, but Lovely Complex was strong all the way from episode 1 to 24, I've even been recommended the manga from a friend as well.
This had me laughing out loud every episode, always put me in a great mood, and had me fall in love with each of the characters. 
The animation is hilarious from the facial and body expressions to how a character can be romanticized one frame and quickly shown as comical in thenext.


Every time I finish an anime like this I like so much, I think I can't find something that will hit me the same way, but I'm always proven wrong and this anime did that for me.


Lovely Complex is about a short student and a tall girl who are a comedy duo, but things get complicated when the tall girl falls in love with the short guy. Each character is very flawed and its great to watch them argue with each other. One narrative the show talks about are the types of relationships students have with each other, and how other people can't see them dating each other, when neither of them cares about the height difference.


Overall, if you like shouju anime, definitely check this one out, you won't be disappointed!

This anime is definitely one of my top favorites now!
  Story-    it's a perfect shoujo story that many people will love even if they are not that into that type of anime. The storyline felt so realistic that I worried about the characters like they were my friends! I can't understand how they did that,but the story just grabbed me from the beginning and didn't let me go. Even after I finished watching it, I've been thinking about the anime for a couple of weeks.  
   I must mention that it is one of the funniest,if not theonly anime that is so hilarious!   Honestly, I laughed 90% of the time! 10% were me crying:)

    The development was very good, it didn't feel rushed or slow,but I wish there were more episodes!


  Art-  the art style is very similiar to Ouran High School Host Club. At first, the drawing style seemed a bit odd.p,but I got used to it super fast.   The way the characters were drawn definitely showed their personalities and also all of the emotions that were depicted suited perfectly and made the process of watching even more enjoyable!


  Sound-  all of the voice actors did a great job with making the characters very lively and fun. 

I am not a big fan of the opening and ending songs, but they still suited the anime very well.


   Characters-   I don' think it's possible not to feel connection to the main characters. Koizumi and Otani were absolutely outstanding! They seemed like real people and that's what I love about Lovely Complex!  All of the other characters were on point too! Each of them played their role in the development of a story. None of them felt unneeded,they all made sense and made the story even more captivating.


  Enjoyment- this anime gave me so many emotions! I am so happy thet I watched it and I recommend it to everyone! Not only it's incredibly funny, it also shows life situations and can even teach you how to behave in certain situations. Since the story is very real, I think a lot of people can either feel connected to it or learn something.

  I am going to rewatch this anime,but I will give it a year or so,because I want to watch this with a fresh mind and feel all of the emotions again!

I don't usually write reviews but I just had to for this since it is my favorite anime of all time. Too many animes nowadays contain a lot of ecchi and sexual innuendos and while most may like that, I don't. To me it just seems lazy when people try to draw you in with big boobs and super cute/hot girls etc. But this anime is totally different. Like the main girl isn't your typical anime girl as she doesn't have the huge boobs, hour-glass figure, or lolicon cuteness. She's just down-to-earth, normal, and tall. The very premise of this anime is very well thoughtout. A non-typical relationship between a tall girl and a short boy, which is rare especially in a high-school in Japan.  \n\n
The best part of this anime is the comedy between the relationships, it's just freaking hilarious. I especially love the facial expressions! Even though the main actor & actress's relationships are the main focus of this anime, I love how all the other relationships are also shown and how they developed. All in all, a perfect anime in my opinion. Especially since it ended well unlike most of the Animes I have seen.

The story was a a little overexaggerated but it was still a very cute idea. I liked how problems occures through natural unchangable events like height issues. In some case it can get pretty frustration on how naive a character can become, but despite all that swagger and people being to picky it still is very exciting to watch. Dont get me wrong, this anime clearly changes the natural thought of romance. Most romance animes are very cliche, but this somehow didnt feel very common to me. So it really made me wonder while i was watching this series, hmmm what can the girl doto show her feelings to the boy. the girl is little less than 20cm taller than him. 


To really put it into perspective, if you like animes that are realistic and all about realism, do not watch this. this is farfetched and is really far from being realistic. first  of all being 180 cm is not that bad for a girl. the boy being 153cm is kind of short, but not bad at either. if it was real life and i really loved the person, the height really wouldnt be a issue; especially is she is like only 6 inches taller than me. and this story will not make too much sense in realism wise. 


but if you like to watch animes for the character and how the character bond, grow, build relationships, and their feelings; more of the human relation style, this anime will definetly will be suitable for you. I loved this anime. it is one of my top5 animes. Why did i love it? it was just plain adorable and heart warming anime. and i love those animes. :)

One of the best animes EVER.

Oh! the sweet trials of young love.
Koizumi Risa, a girl who is slightly taller than your average girls, 
has decided to settle for guys who are taller than her to be 
her potential boyfriend.
Now, it's not an easy task to find a boyfriend when she's always 
been the tallest in class (even taller than the tallest boy!)
A maiden's heart is always fickle and here comes Atsushi Otani.
He's your typical guy, except that he's unusually short for a guy.
Like Koizumi Risa, he has a  height complex 
and only settles for -you guessed it?- girls who are shorter than him.
For both of this duo who hasheight complexes, they bicker non-stop.\n
They eventually became friends but their nonsensical bickering did not end there.\n
They even got a famous nickname and was labelled, \n
"All-Hanshin Kyojin" (which is in actuality, a popular comedic duo \n
that differed in heights, too)\n
Of course, it doesn't help that they sometimes burst out \n
angry words, in sync with each other.\n
People find them amusing as a duo.\n\n
As their friendship unfolds, Risa realize how sweet Otani really is as a guy.\n
She started to have feelings for him but is having doubts whether Otani\n
would ever feel the same way as her.\n\n
With motivations from her closest friends, \n
she tried means and ways to drop a hint at Otani about her true feelings \n
but being such a dense character, Otani does not take the hint. \n
In fact, he was too dense to take a hint.\n\n
When finally everything is out in the open, things takes for a \n
sudden turn when both individuals tries to question this awkward situation \n
where they are not friends and yet, not lovers.\n
Risa tries hard to prove her love for him and Otani tries to accept her \n
to be more than just a friend.\n\n
Of course, the path to love is never smooth-sailing.\n
The ending however, is a sweet treat to all their efforts to uphold true love.\n

A show with a couple minor flaws that are (mostly) overshadowed by the stellar main characters.
Let's get to get the negative points of Lovely Complex out of the way. The story at times was a bit repetitive. Particularly in the middle as Risa seemed to constantly ping-pong back and forth between "I like you Ootani, deal with it" and "you know what, no, let's stay friends, just pretend I didn't say anything". There was a lot of that and not enough happening outside of the pair to carry the show.
The second negative are the human plot devices that were Ootani's next door neighbor Mimi andRisa's coworker Kazuki. Not only were neither believable as viable romantic rivals, but I found it a bit contrived that Mimi just so happened to be very tall (you know, like Risa) and Kazuki just so happened to be very short (you know, like Ootani).


Now that the bad is out of the way, let's talk about the good, specifically the main couple. Risa, the "towering" protagonist, in particular, is my single favorite MC in a romance anime. She's super funny and sweet, kind of a nerd, and with more determination than you might think. You see, she was initially friend-zoned pretty hard by Ootani, but with the occasional push by her (also quite funny) best friend Nobu, she persevered until Ootani's feeling came around. Overall, I found Risa so incredibly endearing and easy to root for. I was genuinely happy when things went well for her.


Now on to the other half, the vertically-challenged Ootani. To me, he is the quintessential, and somewhat rare, "male tsundere". With that, combined with the height, he reminded me of a certain character from one of my favorite romcoms, Toradora. Even though his words are often harsh, deep down, he clearly cared deeply for Risa, and showed it at several key moments. I also appreciate the little guy making it happen on the basketball court too, because if you know anything about that sport, you know it's usually one dominated by people much, much taller than Ootani. My only minor complaint was how dense he was at times. Like half the school, including Risa, told him she liked him and it took like 2 full episodes for him to realize it.


What really made them great, though, were the interactions between the two. Whether they were doing their comedy duo bit, bickering, or geeking out over their shared love of the musician Umibozou, it was consistently entertaining.


As far as the other characters go, the only one that really stood out was Risa's best friend Nobu. She was constantly giving out advice to Risa, and it was oftentimes legitimately funny.


I know I went on about the characters, in particular the two main characters, but to me they were foundation of the show, and I honestly don't have a ton to say about the story, art, or sound. They were all adequate for the genre and year. The voice performances of Risa and Ootani were standouts though.


TL;DR: 

Negatives: Slightly receptive with unnecessary "other" love interests. 

Positives: Risa and Ootani are fantastic together, and Risa is my favorite MC in a romance anime. 


Overall 8/10 really good shoujo anime

The comedy in the show was average at best and it made me laugh some times! It was overly funny and the faces they'd put on sometimes were amazing! The one thing I disliked about the whole thing and I know it's supposed to be a rom-com but at sad/romantic moments they'd try to make everything into a comedic moment which would ruin it sometimes! The story wasn't over barely dramatic with a few exceptions every now and then but it was still enjoyable!


Art 6/10: I definitely was thrown off of the anime due to the art/animation for this show and I was hesitated to watch it even when it started but I still gave it a try! The anime is pretty much awful but it still has it's time here and there and it's still a good watch! The anime is years old and I wouldn't expect it to be a work of art but I still really enjoyed it at romantic/happy moments!


Sound 8/10: Nothing really stood out that much but it also never sucked! Nothing really popped out at any points to make me thing "Wow this is a great soundtrack" but maybe that's because I was more concentrated on the art style and what was happening!


Character 8/10: Each character is unique and is seemed to stay that way the entire way through! It was really well made how they made each of the main characters developed their emotions.. It was good to see him reject her twice first before actually realizing his feelings! If it would of been "Oh I suddenly like you now because you like me" would of made it less amusing and would of made it kind of awkward for me to watch seeing them suddenly sprout a romance from thin air! The supporting characters seemed to have a fairly big decent part in everyone coming together and they weren't overused nor were they barely ever used.. They were used to a decent amount where it affected the story and each of them getting together.


Overall: The story and characters were fairly decent and very enjoyable for a person to watch whose looking for a good story line which will have a happy ending along with a strong romance type that is not appearing out of thin air! I'd highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys romance! I can not say this enough but LOOK PAST THE ANIMATION! TRUST ME! :D

Everyone else has already broken it down, so I am going to get right to the point. I needed something happy and this is a feel good anime that hits the nail on the head. Not only was I shocked to find myself actually busting at the seams laughing, this is the second time I have cried (watching anime)  EVER... and as a tall woman, the inner child in me could soooo relate on so many levels. I just have all.the.feelz. 
Cons: There were times where the lack of continuity of the art style and horridly done proportions got on my nerves, mixed witha few spots of overly teeny bopper-ish behavior... ALL FORGIVEN BECAUSE OF ABOVE SAID AWESOMENESS. \n\n
If you aren't into slice of life (oddly enough this is contradictory since I am one of those people. I sway towards adult, serious, action packed, intense and/or thoroughly crafted plot lines)...then you may not like this. If you value raw emotion and slapstick comedy, give it a whirl - you will be happy you did!

Lovely Complex is a personally important anime for me.  It didn't just expand my horizons in anime, but in all forms of entertainment.  This anime was the first piece of entertainment that ever showed me that you could be enthralled in a story that didn't have guns, kung-fu or explosions.  10 years ago, I thought that liking an anime like this was too "girly", but I figured I'd give it a try and was drawn in immediately by the humor and characters.  Risa, in an odd way, reminded me of an ex that I had just separated from. (She was alsotall and insecure about her height. She was 6'2".).  I think that's what drew me in, as well.  But, thanks to the awesome story, the comedy and the feel good moments, I realized there was much more to Anime than just adventures and magic.  This anime is what paved the way for me to enjoy other great animes like Nodame Cantabile, Suzuka and Ouran High School Host Club.  Looking back, I realize how much amazing anime (and even movies) I would've missed if not for this anime.   \n\n
I would recommend it to anyone, especially younger guys who pass up this kind of anime thinking it won't be good, because of the genre.  Give it a shot.  Trust me. It's an all time great.

Don't let the name fool you...
The story behind Lovely Complex is hardly "complex" by any means, however its wit more than makes up for its lack of story depth.
Honestly, this is a great romantic comedy, even though the romantic side of Lovely Complex is completely dwarfed by the quality humor ever-present throughout the series.  I think that is probably why it works so well, it is abundantly clear within the first episode that this series doesn't make the mistake of taking itself TOO seriously like so many others.  
The humor is something caught in the middle of outright slapstick and surprisingly clever...which isfairly impressive, as it is beyond rare imo, for slapstick to be this funny.    \n\n
The main characters had a great chemistry together(imo, thanks to how well the voice actors, who were great, played off of each other)  and I couldn't help but be charmed by Otani and Risa's relationship.  The supporting cast doesn't make quite as large an impact, but it's not that they aren't loveable characters... so much as Otani and Risa steal the show entirely.\n\n\n
All in all, Lovely Complex is a very enjoyable, albeit simple,  light-hearted series, that should almost certainly keep a smile on your face from start to finish.

At first the series looked like a normal comedy and I wasn't really into it, but as the story progresses you start to want to root for certain characters and each episode I got a laugh out of something. This series is the perfect combination between comedy and romance without ruining both genres. I think anyone who wants a good laugh would really enjoy this series, I know I really did. The art style was a bit off putting at first but I got used to it and Im glad I did because this is now one of my favourite romance animes just because ofthe well plotted out story and sudden plot twists that leads the story in a completely different direction.

This is my favorite romance anime, although its been a while since I watched it the impression that it left still stands strong. Worth a watch if you enjoy a comedy with interesting love situations.
Story: 
I found it to be a very simple formula with interesting twists that keep the viewer interested. Even though it was obvious at times Lovely Complex never disappointed me. With the best developing plot and evolving complications the story never got old.
Art:
I really liked the color in this Anime, it just seemed brighter than most of the ones I have watched. Somewhat simplistic but complimented the scenario quite well.
Sound:
I havenever seen an anime where the sound seemed to outperform others, other than perhaps Nodame Cantabile. Most of the sound depends on the site and equipment used for quality.\n\n
Character:\n
The characters and scenario was fairly average but it seemed to fit the story extremely well. What made it unique was the height, which is what the show is about.\n\n
Enjoyment:\n
I watched this show on a mediocre streaming site and still had a great time watching it. Its shows like this one, where everything seems to come together very well that stand out. I actually plan to make an effort to watch this one over again in the future, and when I do it will be the first one that I have re-watched.\n\n
Overall:\n
Not too long, great art and a nice relaxed setting makes this the perfect anime to watch. Although it could have a second season the story played out nicely. \n\n
The only people that I do not think would enjoy this anime would be ones that do not like romance or strictly stick to an action anime diet.

Story – 9
Lovely Complex or LoveCom’s story is a really funny love story. It demonstrates the immense joy and pain one usually feels when falling for someone, confessing, getting rejected, and getting back up again to live another day. In addition, all the awkward and hilarious moments are done in excellent fashion. Not to mention, it tackles an oddity: tall girl falls for a short guy and is actually making the moves towards the relationship. My only qualm about the story is the small fillers near the end of the show which kept it from getting a 10. Nevertheless, I was truly impressed with thestory and direction.


Animation – 9


The animation fit in really well with the series. I really like the character designs, especially for Koizumi. As the main character, her facial expressions displayed the emotions needed for each scene. The same could be said for the other characters to a lesser extent, but Koizumi’s art style stood out the most and brought this show to another level in terms of emotion and comedy. It was the driving force that meshed well with whatever the situation was at hand.


Characters – 9


The two main characters, Koizumi and Otani, are extremely fun to watch. There is not much in terms of back story for either character, but what they do during the story add to their great personalities. With the characters going back and forth, there is never a dull moment. The other characters are great too and add to the humor and emotion of the show.


Sound – 9


The first OP and ED are much better than the 2nd ones. Tegomass’ “Kimi + Boku = Love?” (OP) manages to create the charming atmosphere of the show while “Kiss ~Kaerimichi no Love Song~” (ED) is a great song in and of itself, with its soft melodies and easy listening feel. In addition, the background music did a great job in reinforcing and portraying emotions and funny situations throughout the show. Koizumi and Otani’s voice actors were perfect for the job and had amazing chemistry.


Enjoyment – 10


I was really impressed with the show overall and it was a lot of fun to watch. I’m glad I picked this series as I was searching for something different to watch from what I normally do. Every episode is genuinely funny, and charmingly non-cliché (fresh, to me anyways – with the tall girl liking the short guy and doing something about it, completely opposite of what we think today!) Definitely a must watch for those who like a natural good comedy, and those who like love stories.


Average Series Rating – 9.2 – Excellent

I have passed this anime up several times for its artwork. The artwork isnt really mainstream although it does fit the series well. Lovely Complex is one of those rare unpolished gems.
What Lovely Complex  lacks in luster it makes up for ten fold in story and humor( some of which you might need to be a bit knowledgable in japanese culture for). The Characters have a true depth that leaves a person to wonder if they might be based on someone the writer knows.
All in all, a suprisingly enjoyable series. If you are looking for flash and glimmer look elsewhere, but if youwant to experience something that has side spliting antics, touching romance, and a soul that is a bit  real and deep Lovely complex is worth investing some curiosity in.

LOVELY*COMPLEX (or Love*Com) the anime was first aired in 2007. There are 24 episodes all together. This anime is actually adapted from a popular shoujo manga (2001 - 2006) by Nakahara Aya with the same title. In 2006, the manga was adapted into a live-action movie.
The very first thing I notice about this anime is the way the characters speak. Obviously, since the setting of this anime is in Osaka, so they are actually speaking in Kansai-ben. The tone is a bit melodic and sometimes it sounds a tad harsher that the normal standard Japanese dialect.
By and large, the strengths of any anime series dependon two core elements: story-lines and characterizations. Plot-wise, this anime has a simple yet unforgettable story lines. I like how the characters struggle in developing their relationship. There are scenes that have, apparently, etched in my mind. There are scenes that make my heart skips a beat (duhh... what's new?). In fact, there are even several scenes that leave a strange 'tingling' in the pit of my stomach. Ahh... the stolen kisses... and who could forget those...\n\n
Next, I really adore the portrayal of the two protagonists in this anime. Koizumi Risa is not your typical Japanese girl. She is taller than any of her peers and in fact, towering at 172cm, she is way taller than any of the typical boys. Well, Otani Atsushi is her exact opposite. He is way too short even for a normal boy. His height is 156cm (that IS short. Even I'm taller than him). Obviously, he is way shorter than Koizumi. To make thing even worse, Koizumi always addresses him as chibiko (midget) and Otani always refers her as Amazon or sometimes Totem Pole. Since they bicker like nobody's bussines, they are dubbed by their homeroom teacher All Hanshin Kyojin, a famous Japanese comedy duo who differ in heights. But, on one fine day (it's night, actually), somehow, they are destined to watch a concert together. That's how the bittersweet romance begins...\n\n
Apparently, after watching this anime, I do believe love is not simply physical. And I do realize, wholeheartedly, that opposite does attract! It is definitely sweet, insightful, funny and endearing. Hence this anime is absolutely recommended by moi.
