It's very rare that I take the time to write a review, but this anime is special.
I took a moment to read a review, and the person had really enjoyed it, and I had come across this anime many many times. 
I will never regret taking a chance to watch this anime. 
Story: It seems like you're typical high school romance, but it stands out from all the rest when you've taken everything into account. Risa is a high school girl, having trouble finding a boyfriend due to being abnormally tall (170 cm). Otani is a high school boy going through the same problems, buthe can't seem to find the right girl (standing around 156 cm last I recall). The two agree to help each other overcome this and search for the right person, but it takes a while for them to realize that the right person might be standing right in front of them. 

The story line is great, and there are some interesting twists that keep you hanging. What seemed weird to me right up until the ending was the whole 'a girl liking a guy shorter than her', like it completely irked me. But I went through with the entire  anime and I fell in love with the characters. What I loved best was the determination Risa shows in this anime, it was truly inspiring.


Art: The art was appropriate for this anime. I don't think it was anything amazing that struck at me and stood out, but I do think it was very well done and it fit. 


Sound: My favorite song from this anime was the ending to the first half of the series, because the mood of the song falls perfectly with it (I'm adding it to my ipod :)). During the anime the sound didn't strike out much either, so it wasn't bad but it wasn't anything amazing either.


Character: The characters are what make this anime amazing. With such a generic story line (don't get me wrong, it was an amazing anime, but clearly not the first time we've heard of a high school romance with issues). However, these characters were inspiring, and when you've gotten into this anime you fall in love. Risa's determination to be together with the boy she likes really inspired me to try harder in the future and I'll certainly keep her in mind when I meet someone special. Otani was the frustrating character here, but his character was played perfectly and I wouldn't have had him changed any other way. The supporting characters really helped with this story and help move the plot along.


Enjoyment: If you've read until here you should be able to tell I enjoyed the anime.


Overall: I highly recommend this anime especially if you love high school anime, romance, or anything in between. It was fantastic and I congratulate the authors who wrote the script for it! I haven't seen an anime this amazing since, well, Yamato Nadeshiko Shichi Henge which had wonderful characters as well.

Story: 7/10
I thought the story behind this anime was great, and I absolutely loved the humour. I tend to watch a lot of these sorts of anime but none of them really seem to stick with me. But this one definitely did! I did find, however, in some parts it was a bit slow.
Art: 9/10
I loved the animation for this anime. The art is exactly the sort I tend to go for when I look for shows in this genre.
Sound: 10/10
I loved the sound in this anime. The music was happy, sad, and even tense at all the right times. I didn't think there wasa single moment where the music was off. Was very helpful for setting the scene. I also loved the beginning and ending music very much. As for the sound effects, they were all spot on! The chosen voices for the characters we're perfect as well.\n\n
Character: 10/10\n
This was my favourite part about the anime. The characters behind Koizumi and Otani were brilliant. Koizumi's a very outgoing, strong girl, but she's extremely timid when it comes to her feelings, which most girls watching can relate well to. Otani's just as outgoing, however, rather than being timid towards his feelings, he's just confused about them and can't understand, which relates to some guys. I loved how the characters are constantly fighting, and teasing each other, and I loved the "All Hanshin Kyojin" aspect of their relationship. It was great how all that didn't change as their relationship grew.\n\n
Enjoyment: 10/10\n
I had put off watching this anime for about 2 years, just because I didn't think I would enjoy it. But it was actually probably one of the most enjoyable anime's I've experienced.\n\n
Overall: 9/10\n
This anime is great! I'd recommend it to anyone, especially if they enjoyed "Ouran High School Host Club," it has the same teasing friendship relationships.

Lovely Complex has to be one of my favourite romantic comedy animes.  The plot is beautifully written about a tall girl trying to win over her crush, a short boy.  The in depth complexity of Risa is so well done, and her feelings are completely relatable.  When she cried, I cried too.  When she laughed, I laughed too.  When anything romantic happened, I was squealing like a schoolgirl.
The plot isn't something that is very predictable, like many romcoms.  I was always pressing the next episode because I wanted to know what happened next.
Something I found interesting is that thewhole series was done with kansai dialect.  I cannot understand everything they said, I needed the subtitles for that, but I could hear the difference in the way they talked from most other animes.  I enjoyed the change.\n\n
Another thing that I enjoyed is that Risa's hairstyle was constantly changing.  Something I find irritating after awhile is that almost no anime characters change their appearance from day to day.  Seeing her hairstyle change, as well as her clothes, was refreshing.\n\n
Overall, I really enjoyed this series and recommend it to anyone that enjoys romantic comedies.  Happy watching!

Every now and then you stumble across an anime that you just fall in love with from the first frame and this is one of those times!
From the intro which has a "Sublime the band" feel to the music , through to the really great voice acting , cute art work ,  comedy timing and touching story line this anime delivers so well. 
I can't stress how this feels a breath of fresh air with the cheeky story line that has been split into great 23 minuet episodes , with some really funny twists , which at one point even pay tribute to thefilm "The Crying Game" in a PG rating way ;) 


You really feel for the characters in this anime and so many things remind me of my teens and the quest to win the heart of your crush. The build up from odd friends to finally discovering feelings for each other is a masterpiece and like me , you will get instantly hooked.


This is a well rounded anime with all the right ingredients and thankfully the perfect result. So often we see anime's fail to deliver , with this you will not regret watching it one bit I promise you!

Standing with Kimi ni Todoke, this is by far the best romance anime I've seen! The thing with this is, it's also amazingly funny.
It's characters are likeable, its hilarious, and its also tear-jerking as well. You find yourself rooting for the main characters love, and just want to hop into the screen and get the two to kiss! It's that emotional! 
It's also unique, because this time the girl is taller than the guy, and it may give you some advice for those of you out there who are best friends with someone and may consider dating them but are too afraid to ask! 
Allin all, I really liked the anime, and I recommend it to people who like romance comedy because it definitely has enough of both of those!

Lovely Complex it's a story about friendship, love, doubts and shows how the teenagers think about love. Koizumi Risa is a tall girl that is at college and never had date anyone before (she didn't even kiss anyone) and she have a friend called Atsushi Otani (that is a short boy). They are often called 'All Hanshin Kyojin' (because of a couple of comediants - a short and a tall one - and they are funny when are together). Both of them have a complex with their size, and thought that because of this they weren't dating anyone so they decide to bet who's goingto find a boyfriend/girlfriend first, but they didn't realize that love can surprise.

I loved the anime. Although compared to the manga it has a lot of changes in the story. But it is good. This story has taught me that there doesn't necessarily have to be 'love' in a relationship for it to work. The characters are al unique and  interesting (not to mention the character development is strong in there). And it has also taught me not to give up on love.

This anime was like most of the other animes that you would find in the Romance department, but there were some things that were different. This anime had them get together early on and not have to ruin it in the end. The characters are well done. The art is amazing and like none other animes, I am referring to most of the work that TV Tokyo has done in the past. I think that most viewers would appreciate this if they were watching it with someone or if you jsut want to get a good romance anime out of the way.

You know how these kinds of animes tease you endlessly with development and generally drags out conflicts that can be solved withing one conversation? This one made a clear gesture to that kind of story.
I've thought about how to describe the tempo of the story and the development of the characters. You know how the change the tires and tank the car in racing in less than a minute? They went in and thought "Right! We have to do this cliche this episode! LET'S GO!" And Hey ho they went and did it, what usually takes 3-4 episodes or in some romcoms a whole damnseason. It puts a veil on the anime bullshit logic that exists almost everywhere and the little is shushed over by the plot saying "WE AIN'T GOT TIME FOR THIS" and it moves on. However, it's not completely flawless in this tempo and that can put you off. But 8/10 times, it's good.


You might recognise the main female character as she is the voice actress behind Nami from One Piece. The tempo suits her perfectly and you might think of early day one piece when Nami were new and her anger refreshing. If you enjoyed that you might enjoy this even more so. Another thing that works well is the use of art. It's not meant to be pretty, it's meant to show exactly what the characters feel. You might find some mess ups or flaws that bother you but mostly it flows very well with the characters and conflicts in the anime.


Really the only real criticism I have is the sound. At some parts, the background noise feels like the background noise of a shit Visual Novel game. It kept bugging me at certain scenes but otherwise, it's just good. When they got the tempo right and their ideas straight this anime is one of the most enjoyable I've seen

Ah Lovely Complex, it is perhaps at the top of my favorites list when it comes to Rom-com anime, it is endearing in ways that you wouldn't expect, but above all: it's... really hilarious.
Story - 8
So at the heart of any masterpiece is a good story, this is no different for Lovely Complex, while I do think the mind-numbing drama in the later episodes can certainly put a casual viewer through their paces, it doesn't overstay it's welcome. Without giving too many details about the plot, it's love-sick comedy driven by two people who are very vertically-conscious of themselves, and while the mundane obligatory dramadoes drop the score a bit, the high points that it hits are done in a way that capitalizes on it's strengths.


Art - 8


Since art is at the center of animation, it's very important that you're staring at something you enjoy looking at, and Lovely Complex doesn't disappoint on this front, I find it is notable that the female lead: Koizumi Risa often changes her hairstyle from day-to-day, I find this to be a welcome dynamic change from the otherwise unchanging static cling of most female leads/protagonists. 


With bursts of vivid color, it is lovely to look at, without being too overbearing, the only problem I could potentially foresee with the casual viewers  is the deformed state the characters devolve into while expressing comedy... but then again, that's part of it's charm.


Sound - 9


I don't make it a point to focus on sound when it comes to most anime, but I have no shame in admitting that I got as giddy as a school-girl every-time I heard the opening theme for the series, it's nothing that's balls to the walls amazing, but it's a nostalgic type of calm music that you don't see too much nowadays. 


On the flip-side of this coin, the ED was pleasing enough to my ears that I didn't see fit to just leave when the episode was over, opting instead to listen to it all the way through, the various OST's and BGM's sprinkled throughout the series did well in setting the mood/tone, the voice-acting was also quite superb


Character - 10


I don't think you'd get an argument from anyone who watched this, if you were to say that the characters were the main deciding point on the debate of whether or not to watch Lovely Complex, the side-characters such as Nakao and Nobu are endearing and receive some actual focus/development, while adding to the comedy-driven antics of our male and female leads, and they do all of this without detracting attention from the stars of the show! I find the balance refreshing and a decent change of pace from the norm.


If I were to describe our leads with a phrase, it would be this: comedy gold-mine. I don't think I'm being too generous when I give this anime credit for being one of (if not the most) funniest things I have ever had the pleasure of experiencing, the comedy will leave you clutching at your sides for days on end, were that not enough we also get a surprising amount of character development sprinkled with some very tender heartwarming moments. You'll fall in love with at least one of the cast, I guarantee it.


Enjoyment - 10


If you're not pissing yourself with laughter, you're too busy crying (along with our female lead) or swooning, you experience such a wide range of emotions when it comes to Lovely Complex, I tend  put a big stress on re-watch ability when it comes to anime dealing with comedy, and this anime gets the gold star in that regard, despite watching it at least twelve times, I still laugh at every joke, and still partake in all the sappiness that ensues.


Overall - 9


I would fully endorse this product for consumption for any anime fan that loves romance as a genre, especially people who enjoy their romances with comedy on the side, you'll find that Lovely Complex has an abundance of both, with a satisfying conclusion that will leave you wanting for nothing (except for a continuation, it's just that good!)

Lovely complex is a romantic comedy and slice of life anime. It was enormous and marvelous because of a not typical love story between uncommon individuals who suddenly fall for each other. In every episode, I absolutely enjoy it for each unexpected scene and charm of all the character even they are not for real. I definitely like the anime; it is worth watching for its clever portrayals of emotions. :)
*PERSONAL IMPLICATION*
What is the most unforgettable about Lovely Complex is the attitude of Koizumi, who never gave up in her love for Otani. I just admire her persistent and dedication.
It is true that in love,you can do everything. You will not easily complain and surrender as long as you have that romantic feeling in you because for sure at the end you will reap what you sow. you cannot see it as a wasteful thing to do. It will give you inspiration, motivation and encouragement to be a better person. In love, nothing is impossible.\n

This is probably my top top TOP Romance Comedy Slice of Life anime I have ever seen. EVER.
Beginning with the story. It's so unconventional (neither character has feeling for one another due to height and personality differences) then Koizumi develops feelings for Otani and the comedy just increases. That may sound typical, and in some ways it (which only works in its favour) but Love*Com takes its time in developing their relationship. Not a single breath of it feels rushed. I have many friends who don't really like this genre much but really thoroughly enjoyed this anime because the comedy far outweighs the romance, butwithout sacrificing that romantic, cheesy gooey happy feeling you get from typical RomCom anime.


The characters are all extremely well developed and the group of friends all play a fairly integral role to the story development.


The soundtrack is second to non. It does a wonderful job of setting the scene, be it comedic or absolute heart wrenching. OH THE FEELS.


The manga art is as always will be, more detailed than the anime. Both are wonderful. Especially when you consider the contrast between characters expressions (Koizumi and Otani often pull very very funny faces) - Don't expect any amazing out of this world special effects or colours or anything truly unique. It's just done well. Easy on the eyes and not afraid to be "ugly"


I don't often re watch anime but I have re watched this three times and have read the manga twice.


I urge everyone to give this one a shot even if the genre doesn't sound like your cup of tea, it truly is a wonderfully hilariously, light hearted and unbelievably heart warming show.

Short Summary: 
This show is as jaw-dropping-funny as an anime will get, but in fact a surprisingly heartwarming tale. Main characters taller-than-your-average-girl Risa, and short-for-his-age Otani as a couple? That already spells disaster (disastrously funny that is) right off the bat! Complemented by superb voice acting and consistent story and character developement, Lovely Complex is, in short, a Rom-Com done right!
I'll try to be as vague and as short and sweet on the categories because like me, I'm sure you also absolutely hate spoilers in reviews.
Story: 
I found that one of the biggest reasons I liked Love-Com so much was because its consistency to progressin its storyline, every episode is very relevant and vital to the main plot, and keeps you locked in and wanting more. Overall, with its ups and downs, at the end of the show, you'll be truely satisfied with everything that happened and would'nt want it to end any other way.


Voice acting: 

Great, the leads were perfectly casted in everyway and never fail to deliver in every episode. One thing I have to nit-pick at is (this pertains to the story too) that the supporting characters were surprisingly weak and barely matter in the grand scheme of things.


Art:

Not your usual huge-eyes small-mouth cuties in this show, but again (I know I'm repeating myself) very appropriate, especially during the hilarious scenes where the characters' fantasies are shown with shimmering eyes and wide open mouthes.


Being a guy, watching a show with labeled in category shoujo is a huge taboo, especially considering that the story is seen through Risa, the female lead's point of view (although Otani is present 90% of the time anyways), but if skipping out on great things is what it takes to be manly, then you've got it all wrong. After all,  it's been years since I've seen a show that actually makes me laugh so hard (and so often) that my stomach starts hurting. I recommend anyone, male or female, at almost any age group to watch this show and get a great kick. 


Enjoy.


-Flash

Lovely Complex has just became on of my favorite romantic comedies.  The scenario in which romance develops on is unique and teaches us the boundlessness of our emotions.  One of my favorite aspects is that this anime is half and half romance and comedy, there's always a sense of comic relief to any seriousness and vice versa, but that still doesn't take away from the captivating emotion inspiring or the hilarious humor (seriously this anime made me laugh so much).  Furthermore, all the characters are great in a variety of ways.  They are unique, entertaining and funny, but also complex whichis really seen in how character relations are grown.  The romance in Lovely Complex centers on actual growth and development of the relationship and feelings, and I think that is splendid.  You will actually view the sentiment and connection between the two main characters flourish to feel a sense of progress and growth that you may be able to relate to.  The anime does time well, it really captures the essence of future, past, and character development, and not only captures our emotions but empathy of separation and love.  Anyways, overall I enjoyed Lovely Complex for how it made me cry in laughter, happiness, and sadness.  Watch it.

I actually really didn't like this anime despite the good reviews it has. A friend recommended this one to me and it sounded just up my alley ... but it wasn't.
***SPOILERS***
See the problem is the characters, well not all of them only a select few.
The guy that comes in on episode 5 or something being Raisa's long lost childhood friend and then he disappears and only shows up when things are starting to get good. Like really? we just suffered through 3 GOOD-AWFUL-BORING episodes and now you show up?? *sigh*
So obviously I didn't finish the series but if there's no point in him then bye-bye.Thank you. The other person is Raisa the main character. You start off the anime and she is freaking hilarious, she is bossy and obnoxious and is a total hoot, I mean if she were my friend I would always be laughing, and then she goes and gets a crush and becomes sappy and depressed and it totally changes her personality from one of spunk to well. "BOO GET OFF THE STAGE" .... \n
Okay so the last character that is a real shit is the "best friend" going through the episodes she is constantly harrassing Raisa and messes everything up like all the time. I understand in an anime you need someone there to help push it along but there has to be a limit. When she is constantly holding her hand and telling her what to do, myself as a viewer, start to wonder if she actually still has a crush on him or if this is now just some big game that will end soon with her going. "Oh well that didn't work, onto the next person."\n
I would have liked the anime, I should have liked it really but, I can only handle so much stupidity, when Raisa keeps kicking a dead horse (metaphorically speaking) it gets real old real fast because no matter how hard she kicks it feels like it is going nowhere.

This is going to fail but w/e.
As a person who doesn't likes the romance genre I can say that I enjoyed this anime. I began to watch it to chill out with something light and not so complex and I though I would watch half of every episode, but I found myself watching the full episodes until 5 A.M.
Story
It's your regular storyline with a girl and a guy slowly falling in love, one of the two is dense and the other doesn't give up on him/her. Nothing special as the story goes. But the idea of a comedy duo was really good. At a timesI was laughing way too much, loved the sad moments ending with a stupid joke, they caught me of guard. The few romance animes that I watched were bringing me a lot moody feelings and I was bored as hell. The only thing I get irritated by was Risa crying too much in the second half of the show. As comedy duo those two were hilarious, not just attempting to be as in most of the animes, as couple they're complete fail and their lovey-dovey moments were boring.


Art

I guess it's typical for this genre. I actually enjoy this kind of art, makes the characters cute or cool. Movements are stiff sometimes though and the hairstyles were bad. At some point it was said that Risa got style, bit most of the clothes she was wearing were awful, that I guess was the try to hide all of her body parts well. There's a lot ugly faces too, but they helped making the whole thing funny.


Sound

I enjoyed the opening and ending songs, the voices not that much. The laughs were at a times so fake that I was wondering if they aren't overdoing it. The crying as well, it was a job not so well done, so I was watching with my speakers almost on mute. 


Characters

With the beginning of the show the two main (Risa and Ootani) hated each other, then they suddenly started helping each other and Risa was running after the guy on the 17 minute of the first episode, so I guess they aren't that complex. Their comedy moments were interesting and funny with their personalities so close. As the show goes on Risa became more and more irritating with the crying thing, though I liked her in her other states of mind. But even that was showing that they're changing at some point. Despite of been rejected twice and misunderstanding a lot of the situations she's really stubborn. Both Risa and Ootani were made kinda realistic, they look like they can't made their mind whether to give up or not, which every one does.

The supporting characters on the other hand were pretty boring. They got some kind of development but in just a few episodes. Seiko-chan was a shock to me, I didn't like that character a lot to begin with, because of all that cuteness.


Enjoyment & Overall

I gave that a 9 & 8 of 10 since I was laughing most of the time and I was in this kind of situation with my boyfriend (on Ootani's side though, but that's other thing). I liked it so much because it was so close to what happens in real life, not just in mine. It was willing to bring happy feelings, not only romance and crying over some girl who was rejected twice. Nowadays most of the anime have the point not to give up, but putted in a example real-life situations make you actually see, that's not so easy thing and bringing a super power won't help.

Lovely Complex is a brilliant romance/comedy, it is very enjoyable to watch, their are two main characters... Risa Koizumi, she is 172 cm the tallest girl in her class.
She is often referred to as an 'amazon' by Otani. Her and Otani are well known as a 'comedy duo' as they always argue and everyone laughs at them.
Their friendship is a love hate one. When Risa sets her eyes on something she wants no matter what in the end she'll get it.
This heart warming anime is cute, adorable and fustrating.
Otani is the second main character he is the shortest boy in the class 154cm.
Although he isshort his basketball skill is flawless.\n
But when 'Maity Sensei' shows Otani up he realizes how oblivious he was being.\n
This love anime is full of unexpected twists which leave you truly shocked, and wanting to know more.\n
Each episode is left on a cliff hanger so the person watching will watch the rest of the whole 24 episodes (not including special ones).

My reviews will be just for personal use... I've seen so may animes already that I've lost track of the stories and characters... 
I'll start reviewing the animes I've seen starting July2011...
Main Characters: Risa Koizumi and Atsushi Otani
I wasn't all that sold out on the drawings at first since I'm into those cute anime art/drawings... but just watching the first episode made me change my mind... 
Characters were detailed... from Koizumi's different hairstyles to Otani's clothes... Risa is actually very pretty and Otani is very cute...
What I loved about this anime is the chemistry of the 2 main characters... I believe that the lead voiceactors have a lot to do with how Risa and Otani became lovable... they complimented each other perfectly! I was already laughing at the 1st 10mins of the 1st episode...\n\n
As for the story, it was nice... it had its twists... there were heartbreaking moments - the "Bear Curry" and the "almost breakup" of the Darlings really got to me... But my fave romantic moment will still be the Birthday Fireworks Kiss... I kept repeating the same scene over and over with a silly smile on my face... :P\n\n
1 thing I wish that they improved on: Otani's change of heart... I know he cares for Risa but it would have been better to really have his side of the story... if there is really a spark, why he fell it love etc...\n\n
Still, Lovely Complex will be one of my favorites... 1 that I can and will recommend to my friends and 1 that I will definitely watch again...  :)

The story is about the tallest girl in her class that starts to fall for the shortest guy. This in itself is a little more unique and different from other romances. It has a lot of comedy mixed with some drama and of course romance. I found it hit the nail on the head on every aspect, especially the comedy, was quite funny. I found myself laughing and then suddenly stopping once it hit it's dramatic moments. Really did good in those fields.
You will get a lot of "rivals" throughout the series to shake them up when Otani and Risa get closer together. Was finefor the start but they do it a lot and it seems to drag the series on longer and you think to yourself "did I just watch this?." None the less, you can easily see pass that since they do a lot more than that as well. Though the ending you will find it was all worth it, since Risa works so hard to make Otani like her.


Art

The art work is nothing like Clannad or Kanon, etc. It's like looking at let's say One Piece or maybe even a bit like Hunter x Hunter in some areas. Older styled kind of. But you can appreciate how they used the art for their comedy sketches and the dramatic moments it shows. Using pretty colors and dark auras to show their emotions and that was always great to see. Some of the faces the characters made was just too funny and some even tugged at your heart strings a tad when it got sad and more intense.


Sound

The sound was great, I preferred the 1st set of opening and ending songs rather than the second, due to how much more smooth it was and how it made me feel when I was watching it. They do well also with how they add sounds to the atmosphere of a scene as well. The sound track is pretty decent if I say so myself.


Characters

Some can argue that the characters could be found annoying, especially Otani for being SO dense. Sometimes you sit there and think how stupid can a person really be? Risa is slightly indecisive but you can't disregard her determination to get Ontai's love (Or you could call her a stalker.) 

Then you have your supporting characters such as:

Nobuko

Nakano

Tanaka

Suzuki


Nobuko was hilarious, she really gave Risa a kick in the ass whenever she was losing hope and it worked out amazingly.

Nakano helped Otani, though it was pointless because Otani was just so damn dense.

Tanaka was just there really, she wasn't much to anything, same with Suzuki. They are what starts it though, but after that they just sit back and act along.


Ending

The ending was everything I wanted and more. Why? Because it actually gave you an ending and didn't leave you on a stupid cliff hanger, hoping for another season or something. You get what you want and it's a cute, happy ending and even funny as well. Puts all the genres that are included in this anime into one decent ending.


My rating here:

9/10


I gave it a 9 because the story was great, just dragged on at some parts and I HATED how dense Otani was and Risa came off as a stalker and kept "giving up" but keeps trying again, was kind of getting old after a few episodes. It is highly recommended though for any romance lover.

All in all, it was the perfect anime to watch if you just want to unwind and have some brainless fun.

Or maybe in her school, while the lead boy is the shortest. So, in short, there are some kind of a mix up about their heights. But because of this, their friendship sprouted. Breath-taking, gut-wrenching and both heart-breaking and heart-warming.
One of the first animes I truly cried at, yet one of the first that made me fall off my chair with laughter.

As good as it gets.  A wonderful, realistic portrayal of young romance, it's blossoming and deepening.  The characters are very endearing and yet real persons. The nearest I can come to a quibble for this series is that I would have expected both leads to have more suitors.  
The emotions that both go through seemed spot on.  I think of myself as reasonably intelligent and though my experience happened in my 20s I remember a girl falling for me and I having no clue.  You have to reorient your whole way of thinking especially if they are a good friend.The dynamics of how both Risa dealt with Otani's initial denseness, and later once he had clued in, how both interacted were the best parts of the series.  But the whole series was really incredibly watchable.


But for this to really work the voice acting had to be spot on and it was.  Risa was voiced by a truly gifted seiyu and Otani wasn't far behind.  I believe this series is undubable (if that's a word).    


The graphics are very good, close to outstanding sometimes, and the music never got in the way.  This is the best romantic comedy anime that I've seen.  The only other one in it's class is Nodame Cantibile.

At the beginning of this series, I liked it but thought it was a pretty typical high school romantic comedy. A few episodes later, I was pleasantly surprised to find it actually went much deeper than that. My sister asked me a few times, "are you STILL watching that anime about the tall girl and the short boy? How much plot can they really make out of that?". Well, actually, quite a lot. The whole series is 25 episodes and somehow the whole height difference gimmick never gets boring and actually continues to be funny throughout. It even gets really quite touching and emotional attimes, and only resorts to typical romance cliches in the last few episodes (this isn't enough to ruin the series though -- it resolves itself pretty well). Any girl whose ever had a crush on an oblivious and tactless boy will be able to identify with Risa, and Otani's feelings are pretty understandable and realistic too. The banter between them and their natural ease with one another is what makes the show so fun and different. If you have even the slightest interest in shojo anime, I highly recommend this.

When I first started to watch Lovely Complex, I felt no small amount of trepidation. However, after the first five or so episodes, I found myself pleasantly surprised by just how much charm such a - dare I say - cheesy rom-com had. 
The characters two main character, Otani and Risa, are a perfect fit for each other apart from their heights. This leads to some very comedic moments. The story line works so well because both Otani and Risa can be so in tune in one scene and then have a massive fall out the next... and it's believable. 
Such a vast contrast inemotions that display themselves in each 20 minute(ish) episode never lets the ball drop. There is barely a dull moment in any of the 24 episodes that seem to be "filler space". Every episode can be watched singularly but, as a whole, it reaches a whole new dimension which warms your heart to the characters.\n
The art style does show a little weakness, at times, when it over exaggerates a certain shot. This, however, is only a matter of opinion that will vary as much as anything else from person to person. \n
A very strong series that needs to be watched, if only once.

Lovely Complex if you liked Kimi ni Todoke there's no doubt you will enjoy this romantic comedy. I was pleased that the story took place over the MC's entire high school life. Seeing them move from one grade to the next in the manner presented is something not that often seen in these types of shows. My biggest fault with the show is that the last 6 episodes are heavily filled with drama. Of course we love that drama but there was so much going on they were jumping from one thing to the next in the blink of an eye it was kinda hardto keep up with it all. Plus since they moved it along so fast things sometimes were resolved in a WTF manner. I just think they should have spread these last 6 episodes out into an extra 4 or 5 to give the drama time to build more. Other then that it was a really enjoyable love story 8/10

This is a Masterpiece of an anime. The quite unique romance of (small boy- tall girl) was nice but what i will say is that story is perfect one the best written. It flows perfectly and has its high's and also its lows its one of those anime which you watch and episode and easilly get carried away and watch 3 or 4 at a given go. the style is not the best i have ever seen but its still ok if you can deal with the (Strange Expressions) that they use then you will really enjoy this, im not sure on what else tosay it has everything, a top story, nice charatcer development and love development and a great ending all i need to say is if you have not watched this series you HAVE NOT LIVED lol.
